newsitem.title: DUBAI: U.S. Navy helicopter crashes in Gulf, crew rescued.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Navy helicopter crashes in Gulf, crew rescued.

text.p: A U.S. Navy helicopter crashed in the northern Gulf on Saturday but all four crew members were rescued, a U.S. Navy statement said.

"Crew members aboard the USS Rentz...rescued four sailors today (Saturday) after their...helicopter crashed in international waters in the northern Arabian Gulf," the U.S. Naval Central Command in the Gulf said.
"The helicopter...was conducting routine operations when it crashed at approximately 2:30 p.m. local time (1130 GMT)," it said, adding an investigation into the cause of the crash was under way.
One member of the helicopter crew was being treated for minor injuries, the navy said.

The U.S. Navy is part of a multinational force which checks shipping in the Gulf to enforce a U.N. trade embargo imposed on Iraq after its 1990 invasion of Kuwait. The United States keep about 20 warships in the Gulf.
